definition: to do things each in one's own way

sentences.english: We shared glances in class and laughed at each other's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们在教室相互凝视着，各自嘲笑对方所讲的笑话。

sentences.english: The power to interpret the present Supplementary Provisions shall remain with the Ministry of Construction and the Ministry of Commerce.
sentences.chinese: 本补充规定由建设部和商务部按照各自职责负责解释。

sentences.english: The three leading cores have developed the unique theory of party building.
sentences.chinese: 党的三代领导核心形成了各自独创性的党风建设理论。

sentences.english: This returns the respective number of days for that particular week day.
sentences.chinese: 这样便返回此特别工作日的各自的天数。

sentences.english: Comments, industry leader who also makes no secret of their endeavors.
sentences.chinese: 言谈中，行业领头羊们也毫不讳言各自的努力方向。

sentences.english: Those who are truly Schumpeterian will reform or revolutionize their industries.
sentences.chinese: 真正的熊彼特主义会在各自的行业进行革新或革命。

sentences.english: What we are doing is their own well, each other interference.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在做的，就是各自安好，互不相扰。

sentences.english: From this place the party again diverged , according to their several fancies.
sentences.chinese: 这伙人根据各自的爱好，又从这里分道扬镳。

sentences.english: Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone.
sentences.chinese: 两人一起欢歌曼舞，同享欢愉，但仍要各自保持自我。

sentences.english: Different Christian sects have divided the list of commandments up differently.
sentences.chinese: 不同的基督宗教派别有各自不同的十诫。

sentences.english: All the services so fists can conduct their own simulconsumedd training.
sentences.chinese: 各军兵种都可以实行各自的模仿练习。

sentences.english: They were asked to sit for photographs in the afternoon, between 2 p.m. and 3 p.m.
sentences.chinese: 下午2到3点之间先要他们各自坐着照了一张像。

sentences.english: All department heads to review the Brand Standards Audit form for their respective area.
sentences.chinese: 所有部门的领导为各自的区域复习品牌标准审核表。

sentences.english: Let us go on our separate ways and search for our own partners.
sentences.chinese: 就让我们各走各的路，各自寻找自己的另一半吧。

sentences.english: Each party insists that its levers will work best.
sentences.chinese: 每个党派都坚持认为各自的杠杆最有效。

sentences.english: BP thinks both Anadarko and Mitsui should pay their share.
sentences.chinese: BP认为阿纳达科和三井应该承担各自份额。

definition: to have nothing in common with each other (idiom)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
